channel.title: The Golden Wind on Osho - The complete works of Osho
channel.description: Recent content in The Golden Wind on Osho - The complete works of Osho

image.title: Osho - The complete works of Osho

item.title: Chapter title: None
item.description: < Previous | Contents | Next > ‌Chapter title: None‌ 1 July 1980 pm in Chuang Tzu Auditorium Archive code: 8007015 ShortTitle: GWIND01 Audio: No Video: No [NOTE: This is an unedited tape transcript of an unpublished darshan diary, which has been scanned and cleaned up. It is for reference purposes only.] The only way to know god, to feel god, is meditation. Meditation means a state of consciousness when all thoughts have been dropped.

item.title: Chapter title: None
item.description: < Previous | Contents | Next > ‌Chapter title: None‌ 10 July 1980 pm in Chuang Tzu Auditorium Archive code: 8007105 ShortTitle: GWIND10 Audio: No Video: No [NOTE: This is an unedited tape transcript of an unpublished darshan diary, which has been scanned and cleaned up. It is for reference purposes only.] Man can come to truth only through meditation. Truth is not something that mind can know. Mind can theorise about it, but 'about' means around -- and mind goes about and about, around and around.

item.title: Chapter title: None
item.description: < Previous | Contents | Next > ‌Chapter title: None‌ 11 July 1980 pm in Chuang Tzu Auditorium Archive code: 8007115 1/08/07 Copyright Osho International Foundation 1994 Osho's books on CD-ROM, published and unpublished Query:- ShortTitle: GWIND11 Audio: No Video: No [NOTE: This is an unedited tape transcript of an unpublished darshan diary, which has been scanned and cleaned up. It is for reference purposes only.] There is a great difference between a student and a disciple.

item.title: Chapter title: None
item.description: < Previous | Contents | Next > ‌Chapter title: None‌ 12 July 1980 pm in Chuang Tzu Auditorium Archive code: 8007125 ShortTitle: GWIND12 Audio: No Video: No [NOTE: This is an unedited tape transcript of an unpublished darshan diary, which has been scanned and cleaned up. It is for reference purposes only.] Man has lost grace, animals still have it -- wild animals, more so. In a zoo they start losing grace and beauty, they start becoming perverted.

item.title: Chapter title: None
item.description: < Previous | Contents | Next > ‌Chapter title: None‌ 13 July 1980 pm in Chuang Tzu Auditorium Archive code: 8007135 ShortTitle: GWIND13 Audio: No Video: No [NOTE: This is an unedited tape transcript of an unpublished darshan diary, which has been scanned and cleaned up. It is for reference purposes only.] Man builds his life on the sands of dreams. That's why whatsoever one tries to do, everything fails, all houses collapse.

item.title: Chapter title: None
item.description: < Previous | Contents | Next > ‌Chapter title: None‌ 14 July 1980 pm in Chuang Tzu Auditorium Archive code: 8007145 ShortTitle: GWIND14 Audio: No Video: No [NOTE: This is an unedited tape transcript of an unpublished darshan diary, which has been scanned and cleaned up. It is for reference purposes only.] Man lives in misery because of cowardliness. There is no other cause for it. It is fear of the unknown that keeps man clinging to his misery, because misery is known, well-known.

item.title: Chapter title: None
item.description: < Previous | Contents | Next > ‌Chapter title: None‌ 15 July 1980 pm in Chuang Tzu Auditorium Archive code: 8007155 ShortTitle: GWIND15 Audio: No Video: No [NOTE: This is an unedited tape transcript of an unpublished darshan diary, which has been scanned and cleaned up. It is for reference purposes only.] Man remains a beggar unless he knows what the truth is. And the truth is only one. It is neither mine nor yours; it does not belong to anybody, to any religion, to any ideology, to any church, to any country, to any time.

item.title: Chapter title: None
item.description: < Previous | Contents | Next > ‌Chapter title: None‌ 16 July 1980 pm in Chuang Tzu Auditorium Archive code: 8007165 ShortTitle: GWIND16 Audio: No Video: No [NOTE: This is an unedited tape transcript of an unpublished darshan diary, which has been scanned and cleaned up. It is for reference purposes only.] The revolution begins with bliss. One cannot grow in sadness, in misery; one can grow only in blissfulness, because when one is miserable the being shrinks, it closes.

item.title: Chapter title: None
item.description: < Previous | Contents | Next > ‌Chapter title: None‌ 17 July 1980 pm in Chuang Tzu Auditorium Archive code: 8007175 ShortTitle: GWIND17 Audio: No Video: No [NOTE: This is an unedited tape transcript of an unpublished darshan diary, which has been scanned and cleaned up. It is for reference purposes only.] Mind lives in doubt. Doubt is the climate which is absolutely necessary for the mind to exist. In the same way trust is the climate in which the heart grows; they are polar opposites.

item.title: Chapter title: None
item.description: < Previous | Contents | Next > ‌Chapter title: None‌ 18 July 1980 pm in Chuang Tzu Auditorium Archive code: 8007185 ShortTitle: GWIND18 Audio: No Video: No [NOTE: This is an unedited tape transcript of an unpublished darshan diary, which has been scanned and cleaned up. It is for reference purposes only.] Misery is a by-product of being unconscious, unaware and in the same way bliss is also a by-product, a by-product of being conscious, alert, watchful, vigilant.

item.title: Chapter title: None
item.description: < Previous | Contents | Next > ‌Chapter title: None‌ 19 July 1980 pm in Chuang Tzu Auditorium Archive code: 8007195 ShortTitle: GWIND19 Audio: No Video: No 1/08/07 Copyright Osho International Foundation 1994 Osho's books on CD-ROM, published and unpublished Query:- [NOTE: This is an unedited tape transcript of an unpublished darshan diary, which has been scanned and cleaned up. It is for reference purposes only.] Misery is something like going downhill: it is so easy, no intelligence is needed, no work upon yourself is needed.

item.title: Chapter title: None
item.description: < Previous | Contents | Next > ‌Chapter title: None‌ 2 July 1980 pm in Chuang Tzu Auditorium Archive code: 8007025 ShortTitle: GWIND02 Audio: No Video: No [NOTE: This is an unedited tape transcript of an unpublished darshan diary, which has been scanned and cleaned up. It is for reference purposes only.] In Celtic mythology Birthe is the daughter of the goddess of wisdom and song. This is a very significant symbol: it is very rare to find in any other mythology the combination of wisdom and song.

item.title: Chapter title: None
item.description: < Previous | Contents | Next > ‌Chapter title: None‌ 20 July 1980 pm in Chuang Tzu Auditorium Archive code: 8007205 ShortTitle: GWIND20 Audio: No Video: No [NOTE: This is an unedited tape transcript of an unpublished darshan diary, which has been scanned and cleaned up. It is for reference purposes only.] Truth is achieved not by thinking, truth is achieved by a state of no-thought, because only when you are in a state of no-thought is there clarity.

item.title: Chapter title: None
item.description: < Previous | Contents | Next > ‌Chapter title: None‌ 21 July 1980 pm in Chuang Tzu Auditorium Archive code: 8007215 ShortTitle: GWIND21 Audio: No Video: No 1/08/07 Copyright Osho International Foundation 1994 Osho's books on CD-ROM, published and unpublished Query:- [NOTE: This is an unedited tape transcript of an unpublished darshan diary, which has been scanned and cleaned up. It is for reference purposes only.] Religions have not been able to create a synthesis between bliss and peace.

item.title: Chapter title: None
item.description: < Previous | Contents | Next > ‌Chapter title: None‌ 22 July 1980 pm in Chuang Tzu Auditorium Archive code: 8007225 ShortTitle: GWIND22 1/08/07 Copyright Osho International Foundation 1994 Osho's books on CD-ROM, published and unpublished Query:- Audio: No Video: No [NOTE: This is an unedited tape transcript of an unpublished darshan diary, which has been scanned and cleaned up. It is for reference purposes only.] Mind is always mediocre. Mind is never bright, never brilliant.

item.title: Chapter title: None
item.description: < Previous | Contents | Next > ‌Chapter title: None‌ 23 July 1980 pm in Chuang Tzu Auditorium Archive code: 8007235 ShortTitle: GWIND23 Audio: No Video: No [NOTE: This is an unedited tape transcript of an unpublished darshan diary, which has been scanned and cleaned up. It is for reference purposes only.] One can help others only if one has come to realize one's ultimate nature; otherwise oneself remains in darkness.

item.title: Chapter title: None
item.description: < Previous | Contents | Next > ‌Chapter title: None‌ 24 July 1980 pm in Chuang Tzu Auditorium Archive code: 8007245 ShortTitle: GWIND24 Audio: No Video: No 1/08/07 Copyright Osho International Foundation 1994 Osho's books on CD-ROM, published and unpublished Query:- [NOTE: This is an unedited tape transcript of an unpublished darshan diary, which has been scanned and cleaned up. It is for reference purposes only.] Moses is one of the most beautiful names; it has three meanings and all are significant.

item.title: Chapter title: None
item.description: < Previous | Contents | Next > ‌Chapter title: None‌ 25 July 1980 pm in Chuang Tzu Auditorium Archive code: 8007255 ShortTitle: GWIND25 Audio: No Video: No [NOTE: This is an unedited tape transcript of an unpublished darshan diary, which has been scanned and cleaned up. It is for reference purposes only.] Arunachalam is a sacred mountain. In the South no other place has so much sanctity. For centuries many people have become enlightened on Arunachalam, and one of the last and greatest was Maharishi Raman.

item.title: Chapter title: None
item.description: < Previous | Contents | Next > ‌Chapter title: None‌ 26 July 1980 pm in Chuang Tzu Auditorium Archive code: 8007265 ShortTitle: GWIND26 Audio: No Video: No [NOTE: This is an unedited tape transcript of an unpublished darshan diary, which has been scanned and cleaned up. It is for reference purposes only.] The search for truth is good as far as the beginning is concerned, but a moment comes when you have to go beyond it because the very search is a tension, a strain.

item.title: Chapter title: None
item.description: < Previous | Contents | Next > ‌Chapter title: None‌ 28 July 1980 pm in Chuang Tzu Auditorium Archive code: 8007275 ShortTitle: GWIND28 Audio: No Video: No [NOTE: This is an unedited tape transcript of an unpublished darshan diary, which has been scanned and cleaned up. It is for reference purposes only.] There have been two kinds of religion in the world: the religions of meditation and the religions of prayer.

item.title: Chapter title: None
item.description: < Previous | Contents | Next > ‌Chapter title: None‌ 29 July 1980 pm in Chuang Tzu Auditorium Archive code: 8007285 ShortTitle: GWIND29 1/08/07 Copyright Osho International Foundation 1994 Osho's books on CD-ROM, published and unpublished Query:- Audio: No Video: No [NOTE: This is an unedited tape transcript of an unpublished darshan diary, which has been scanned and cleaned up. It is for reference purposes only.] What is the meaning of your name?

item.title: Chapter title: None
item.description: < Previous | Contents | Next > ‌Chapter title: None‌ 30 July 1980 pm in Chuang Tzu Auditorium Archive code: 8007295 ShortTitle: GWIND30 Audio: No Video: No [NOTE: This is an unedited tape transcript of an unpublished darshan diary, which has been scanned and cleaned up. It is for reference purposes only.] One of the meanings of Myriam is the exalted. The moment a person becomes blissful he is exalted to the highest peak of consciousness, victory.

item.title: Chapter title: None
item.description: < Previous | Contents | Next > ‌Chapter title: None‌ 3 July 1980 pm in Chuang Tzu Auditorium Archive code: 8007035 1/08/07 Copyright Osho International Foundation 1994 Osho's books on CD-ROM, published and unpublished Query:- ShortTitle: GWIND03 Audio: No Video: No [NOTE: This is an unedited tape transcript of an unpublished darshan diary, which has been scanned and cleaned up. It is for reference purposes only.] For centuries religions all over the world have been telling people to serve humanity, but it has not produced any effect, it has not served any purpose.

item.title: Chapter title: None
item.description: < Previous | Contents ‌Chapter title: None‌ 31 July 1980 pm in Chuang Tzu Auditorium Archive code: 8007305 ShortTitle: GWIND31 Audio: No Video: No [NOTE: This is an unedited tape transcript of an unpublished darshan diary, which has been scanned and cleaned up. It is for reference purposes only.] The old idea of nobleness is based in a very false notion: it is rooted in birth, as if a person is born noble.

item.title: Chapter title: None
item.description: < Previous | Contents | Next > ‌Chapter title: None‌ 4 July 1980 pm in Chuang Tzu Auditorium Archive code: 8007045 ShortTitle: GWIND04 Audio: No Video: No [NOTE: This is an unedited tape transcript of an unpublished darshan diary, which has been scanned and cleaned up. It is for reference purposes only.] Marianne is a very beautiful name, of great meaning. It also has a paradox in it. That paradox makes it even more beautiful, more truthful.

item.title: Chapter title: None
item.description: < Previous | Contents | Next > ‌Chapter title: None‌ 5 July 1980 pm in Chuang Tzu Auditorium Archive code: 8007055 ShortTitle: GWIND05 Audio: No Video: No [NOTE: This is an unedited tape transcript of an unpublished darshan diary, which has been scanned and cleaned up. It is for reference purposes only.] Man can live either by his own will or as part of god's will. The first is the way of the ignorant person, and because of that the ignorant person suffers.

item.title: Chapter title: None
item.description: < Previous | Contents | Next > ‌Chapter title: None‌ 6 July 1980 pm in Chuang Tzu Auditorium Archive code: 8007065 ShortTitle: GWIND06 Audio: No Video: No [NOTE: This is an unedited tape transcript of an unpublished darshan diary, which has been scanned and cleaned up. It is for reference purposes only.] Meditation is a process of alchemy. It is a very wrong notion, but very prevalent all over the world, that alchemy was just primitive chemistry.

item.title: Chapter title: None
item.description: < Previous | Contents | Next > ‌Chapter title: None‌ 1/08/07 Copyright Osho International Foundation 1994 Osho's books on CD-ROM, published and unpublished Query:- 7 July 1980 pm in Chuang Tzu Auditorium Archive code: 8007075 ShortTitle: GWIND07 Audio: No Video: No [NOTE: This is an unedited tape transcript of an unpublished darshan diary, which has been scanned and cleaned up. It is for reference purposes only.] Sannyas is the beginning of becoming part of existence.

item.title: Chapter title: None
item.description: < Previous | Contents | Next > ‌Chapter title: None‌ 8 July 1980 pm in Chuang Tzu Auditorium Archive code: 8007085 ShortTitle: GWIND08 Audio: No Video: No [NOTE: This is an unedited tape transcript of an unpublished darshan diary, which has been scanned and cleaned up. It is for reference purposes only.] The most significant thing about bliss is the it is intrinsically a paradox and because of its paradoxical nature it has almost always been misunderstood.

item.title: Chapter title: None
item.description: < Previous | Contents | Next > ‌Chapter title: None‌ 9 July 1980 pm in Chuang Tzu Auditorium Archive code: 8007095 ShortTitle: GWIND09 Audio: No Video: No [NOTE: This is an unedited tape transcript of an unpublished darshan diary, which has been scanned and cleaned up. It is for reference purposes only.] For man there are only two possibilities of existing in the world: one is through the mind and the other is through meditation.
